case_vignette: a 50-year-old african american male with past medical history of hypertension and hypertension presents for evaluation of light spots on his legs that he initially noticed one year ago. the lesions are not painful or itchy, but he is concerned that they are increasing in frequency. when they first develop they do not significantly grow in size. he has not tried any treatments. physical examination demonstrates multiple hypopigmented ovoid macules scattered on the distal shins bilaterally.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have light spots on my legs that I first noticed a year ago, and they seem to be increasing in number.
Have the spots changed color or have they remained the same since you first noticed them?
The spots have remained the same color since I first noticed them.
Do these spots cause any itching, pain, or discomfort?
No, the spots are not painful or itchy.
Have you had any recent exposure to chemicals, new skincare products or medications?
No, I have not tried any treatments or had exposure to new chemicals, skincare products, or medications.
Do you have any known allergies or autoimmune conditions?
I have a history of hypertension, but no known allergies or autoimmune conditions.
Is there a family history of skin conditions or autoimmune diseases?
I haven't mentioned any family history of skin conditions or autoimmune diseases.
Final Diagnosis: Idiopathic Guttate Hypomelanosis
